channel.title: How do I make a command, one use only?
channel.description:
Hey well the topic title says it all really, thanks for anyhelp I get. :)
Mankk.

item.title: How do I make a command, one use only?
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

What the hell are you talking about?
Use a bufferedwriter to write starter to the character’s moreinfo file.

Then there are no possible exploits to this command.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make a command, one use only?

You have to declare starter == 0 {

item.source: How do I make a command, one use only?

item.title: How do I make a command, one use only?
item.dc:creator: @mankk mankk
item.description:
@mankk wrote:

Urm, theres a problem when I try and run compile I get the following errors: client.java:8871: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable starter
location: class client
if (starter == 0) {
^
client.java:8875: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable starter
location: class client
starter = 1;
^
client.java:8876: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable starter
location: class client
} else if (starter == 1) {
^
Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
3 errors
Press any key to continue . . .

Help if you can please Thankyou

Read full topic
item.source: How do I make a command, one use only?

item.title: How do I make a command, one use only?
item.dc:creator: @Stanyer Stanyer
item.description:
@Stanyer wrote:

[quote=“bugra52, post:2, topic:162444”]if (command.equalsIgnoreCase("starter")) { if (starter == 0) { addItem(995, 450000); addItem(380, 56); sendMessage("This is your only starter pack!"); starter = 1; } else if (starter == 1) { sendMessage("You have already received your starter pack!"); } }[/quote]

Hmm very decent security… Looks hard to get around…

OH WAIT! Just log off and back on!

Read full topic
